===================================
Specific Adaptation Strategies
===================================

By including this section in its LTS, Jamaica seeks to protect its cultural heritage and indigenous knowledge from the risks posed by climate change. The strategy focuses on safeguarding heritage sites, documenting traditional knowledge, and raising public awareness. Key initiatives include creating a comprehensive inventory of vulnerable cultural heritage, implementing adaptive measures at heritage sites, fostering collaboration with indigenous communities, and promoting education and outreach on cultural values and history.

The specific actions modeled under the LTS scenario are:

  •	Elevate the structures of 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Elevate equipment in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Install hurricane/wind roof clips and tides in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Install impact-resistant windows and doors in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Install high-efficiency toilets in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Install water-efficient faucets and shower heads in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Install rainwater collection tanks in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Apply Prodex 10mm insulation and radiant barriers in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Use lightweight concrete walls instead of blocks in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
  •	Install double-glazed windows in 2 heritage sites per year from 2025 to 2045.
